title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
summary: The prime minister of the United Kingdom is the head of the government of the United Kingdom and the chief administrative officer of the ministers of the Crown in the  executive branch of Her Majesty's Government. The prime minister chairs the Cabinet and selects its ministers, and advises the sovereign on the exercise of much of the royal prerogative. As modern prime ministers hold office by virtue of their ability to command the confidence of the House of Commons, they sit as a member of Parliament.
